title: TODD_JENNINGS_DATA
description:
Data depicts prices of poultry meat cuts categorized by price, month, year, and specific
cut.
contents:
Data



My data is ‘poultry’

# A tibble: 600 x 4
   Product  Year Month     Price_Dollar
   <chr>   <dbl> <chr>            <dbl>
 1 Whole    2013 January           2.38
 2 Whole    2013 February          2.38
 3 Whole    2013 March             2.38
 4 Whole    2013 April             2.38
 5 Whole    2013 May               2.38
 6 Whole    2013 June              2.38
 7 Whole    2013 July              2.38
 8 Whole    2013 August            2.38
 9 Whole    2013 September         2.38
10 Whole    2013 October           2.38
# ... with 590 more rows

title: My first distill post
description: I can't believe how easy it is to use R.
contents:
This is my first post in R using the distill package! Check out my R code.


2+2


[1] 4

x<-4
y<-6

x+y


[1] 10

title: Still Learning the GitHib Workflow
contents:
Using Markdown is fun!
I learned a lot this summer — Markdown is your friend, as are flexdashboard and Stack Overflow.
Also, always keep in mind that social scientists understand data and data management just as well (if not better) than the computer scientists.
TidyTuesday
New goal: Participate in Tidy Tuesdays

title: Welcome to DACSS 601
contents: Welcome to the Data Analytics and Computational Social Science Programs’ Orientation 2021 session of DACSS 601 Foundations of Data Science. This blog will feature the work of our incoming M.S. students taking the class, as well as PhD students in the College of Behavioral and Social Sciences who have decided to participate through “R Bootcamp”.
